H0.text: Which gland controls the release of hormones. Pituitary

H1.text: Which gland controls the release of hormones. Thyroid

H2.text: Which gland controls the release of hormones. Adrenal

H3.text: Which gland controls the release of hormones. Hypophyse

A4.text: The hypothalamic-hypophysial portal system secretes hypothalamic hormones to the anterior pituitary lobe, indicating the hypothalamus regulates pituitary hormone release.

A5.text: The anterior pituitary contains cell types that synthesize and secrete hormones, showing it is a gland that releases hormones under hypothalamic control.

A6.text: Cortical development of the adrenal gland is regulated mostly by ACTH, a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that stimulates cortisol synthesis.

A7.text: Glucocorticoid synthesis is stimulated by adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), a hormone released into the bloodstream by the anterior pituitary.
